package com.northcoders.jvevents;

import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity;

import android.os.Bundle;

import com.northcoders.jvevents.fragment.EventsFragment;

public class MainActivity extends AppCompatActivity {

 @Override
 protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
 setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);
 
 if (savedInstanceState == null) {
 // Load the EventsFragment when the activity starts
 getSupportFragmentManager().beginTransaction()
 .replace(R.id.fragment_container, new EventsFragment())
 .commit();
 }
 }
}

```
@@ -1,1 +1,37 @@
+package com.northcoders.jvevents.api;
 
+import okhttp3.OkHttpClient;
+import okhttp3.logging.HttpLoggingInterceptor;
+import retrofit2.Retrofit;
+import retrofit2.converter.gson.GsonConverterFactory;
+
+public class RetrofitInstance {
+ // Change this to your actual backend URL
+ private static final String BASE_URL = "http://10.0.2.2:8080/";
+ private static ApiService apiService;
+
+ public static ApiService getApiService() {
+ if (apiService == null) {
+ // Create logging interceptor
+ HttpLoggingInterceptor interceptor = new HttpLoggingInterceptor();
+ interceptor.setLevel(HttpLoggingInterceptor.Level.BODY);
+
+ // Create HTTP client with interceptor
+ OkHttpClient client = new OkHttpClient.Builder()
+ .addInterceptor(interceptor)
+ .build();
+
+ // Create Retrofit instance
+ Retrofit retrofit = new Retrofit.Builder()
+ .baseUrl(BASE_URL)
+ .client(client)
+ .addConverterFactory(GsonConverterFactory.create())
+ .build();
+
+ // Create API service
+ apiService = retrofit.create(ApiService.class);
+ }
+
+ return apiService;
+ }
+}
```

Now let's create the Event Repository:"}],"tool_calls":[{"id":"toolu_bdrk_019AP7mZyR6weuMtv6YUCdqn","type":"function","function":{"name":"edit_file","arguments":"{"target_file": "app/src/main/java/com/northcoders/jvevents/repository/EventRepository.java", "instructions": "Create EventRepository class", "code_edit": "package com.northcoders.jvevents.repository;\n\nimport android.util.Log;\n\nimport androidx.lifecycle.LiveData;\nimport androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData;\n\nimport com.northcoders.jvevents.api.ApiService;\nimport com.northcoders.jvevents.api.RetrofitInstance;\nimport com.northcoders.jvevents.model.EventDTO;\n\nimport java.util.List;\n\nimport retrofit2.Call;\nimport retrofit2.Callback;\nimport retrofit2.Response;\n\npublic class EventRepository {\n private static final String TAG = \"EventRepository\";\n \n private final ApiService apiService;\n private final MutableLiveData<List<EventDTO>> eventsLiveData = new MutableLiveData<>();\n private final MutableLiveData<Boolean> isLoadingLiveData = new MutableLiveData<>();\n private final MutableLiveData<String> errorMessageLiveData = new MutableLiveData<>();\n \n public EventRepository() {\n apiService = RetrofitInstance.getApiService();\n }\n \n public LiveData<List<EventDTO>> getEventsLiveData() {\n return eventsLiveData;\n }\n \n public LiveData<Boolean> getIsLoadingLiveData() {\n return isLoadingLiveData;\n }\n \n public LiveData<String> getErrorMessageLiveData() {\n return errorMessageLiveData;\n }\n \n public void fetchAllEvents() {\n isLoadingLiveData.setValue(true);\n \n apiService.getAllEvents().enqueue(new Callback<List<EventDTO>>() {\n @Override\n public void onResponse(Call<List<EventDTO>> call, Response<List<EventDTO>> response) {\n isLoadingLiveData.setValue(false);\n \n if (response.isSuccessful() && response.body() != null) {\n eventsLiveData.setValue(response.body());\n Log.d(TAG, \"Events fetched successfully. Count: \" + response.body().size());\n } else {\n errorMessageLiveData.setValue(\"Failed to load events: \" + \n (response.errorBody() != null ? response.code() : \"Unknown error\"));\n Log.e(TAG, \"Failed to fetch events. Response code: \" + response.code());\n }\n }\n \n @Override\n public void onFailure(Call<List<EventDTO>> call, Throwable t) {\n isLoadingLiveData.setValue(false);\n errorMessageLiveData.setValue(\"Network error: \" + t.getMessage());\n Log.e(TAG, \"Error fetching events\", t);\n }\n });\n }\n}"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"edit_file","tool_call_id":"toolu_bdrk_019AP7mZyR6weuMtv6YUCdqn","content":"The apply model made the following changes to the file:

```
@@ -1,1 +1,68 @@
+package com.northcoders.jvevents.repository;
 
+import android.util.Log;
+
+import androidx.lifecycle.LiveData;
+import androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData;
+
+import com.northcoders.jvevents.api.ApiService;
+import com.northcoders.jvevents.api.RetrofitInstance;
+import com.northcoders.jvevents.model.EventDTO;
+
+import java.util.List;
+
+import retrofit2.Call;
+import retrofit2.Callback;
+import retrofit2.Response;
+
+public class EventRepository {
+ private static final String TAG = "EventRepository";
+
+ private final ApiService apiService;
+ private final MutableLiveData<List<EventDTO>> eventsLiveData = new MutableLiveData<>();
+ private final MutableLiveData<Boolean> isLoadingLiveData = new MutableLiveData<>();
+ private final MutableLiveData<String> errorMessageLiveData = new MutableLiveData<>();
+
+ public EventRepository() {
+ apiService = RetrofitInstance.getApiService();
+ }
+
+ public LiveData<List<EventDTO>> getEventsLiveData() {
+ return eventsLiveData;
+ }
+
+ public LiveData<Boolean> getIsLoadingLiveData() {
+ return isLoadingLiveData;
+ }
+
+ public LiveData<String> getErrorMessageLiveData() {
+ return errorMessageLiveData;
+ }
+
+ public void fetchAllEvents() {
+ isLoadingLiveData.setValue(true);
+
+ apiService.getAllEvents().enqueue(new Callback<List<EventDTO>>() {
+ @Override
+ public void onResponse(Call<List<EventDTO>> call, Response<List<EventDTO>> response) {
+ isLoadingLiveData.setValue(false);
+
+ if (response.isSuccessful() && response.body() != null) {
+ eventsLiveData.setValue(response.body());
+ Log.d(TAG, "Events fetched successfully. Count: " + response.body().size());
+ } else {
+ errorMessageLiveData.setValue("Failed to load events: " +
+ (response.errorBody() != null ? response.code() : "Unknown error"));
+ Log.e(TAG, "Failed to fetch events. Response code: " + response.code());
+ }
+ }
+
+ @Override
+ public void onFailure(Call<List<EventDTO>> call, Throwable t) {
+ isLoadingLiveData.setValue(false);
+ errorMessageLiveData.setValue("Network error: " + t.getMessage());
+ Log.e(TAG, "Error fetching events", t);
+ }
+ });
+ }
+}
```

+package com.northcoders.jvevents.viewmodel;
 
+import android.app.Application;
+
+import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
+import androidx.lifecycle.AndroidViewModel;
+import androidx.lifecycle.LiveData;
+
+import com.northcoders.jvevents.model.EventDTO;
+import com.northcoders.jvevents.repository.EventRepository;
+
+import java.util.List;
+
+public class MainViewModel extends AndroidViewModel {
+ private final EventRepository repository;
+
+ public MainViewModel(@NonNull Application application) {
+ super(application);
+ repository = new EventRepository();
+ }
+
+ public LiveData<List<EventDTO>> getEvents() {
+ return repository.getEventsLiveData();
+ }
+
+ public LiveData<Boolean> isLoading() {
+ return repository.getIsLoadingLiveData();
+ }
+
+ public LiveData<String> getErrorMessage() {
+ return repository.getErrorMessageLiveData();
+ }
+
+ public void loadEvents() {
+ repository.fetchAllEvents();
+ }
+}

@@ -1,1 +1,75 @@
+package com.northcoders.jvevents.adapter;
 
+import android.view.LayoutInflater;
+import android.view.View;
+import android.view.ViewGroup;
+import android.widget.TextView;
+
+import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
+import androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView;
+
+import com.northcoders.jvevents.R;
+import com.northcoders.jvevents.model.EventDTO;
+
+import java.util.ArrayList;
+import java.util.List;
+
+public class EventsAdapter extends RecyclerView.Adapter<EventsAdapter.EventViewHolder> {
+
+ private List<EventDTO> events = new ArrayList<>();
+ private final OnEventClickListener listener;
+
+ public interface OnEventClickListener {
+ void onEventClick(EventDTO event);
+ }
+
+ public EventsAdapter(OnEventClickListener listener) {
+ this.listener = listener;
+ }
+
+ @NonNull
+ @Override
+ public EventViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(@NonNull ViewGroup parent, int viewType) {
+ View view = LayoutInflater.from(parent.getContext())
+ .inflate(R.layout.item_event, parent, false);
+ return new EventViewHolder(view);
+ }
+
+ @Override
+ public void onBindViewHolder(@NonNull EventViewHolder holder, int position) {
+ EventDTO event = events.get(position);
+ holder.title.setText(event.getTitle());
+ holder.description.setText(event.getDescription());
+
+ // Format date and location
+ String dateLocation = event.getEventDate() + " at " + event.getLocation();
+ holder.dateLocation.setText(dateLocation);
+
+ holder.itemView.setOnClickListener(v -> {
+ if (listener != null) {
+ listener.onEventClick(event);
+ }
+ });
+ }
+
+ @Override
+ public int getItemCount() {
+ return events.size();
+ }
+
+ public void setEvents(List<EventDTO> events) {
+ this.events = events;
+ notifyDataSetChanged();
+ }
+
+ static class EventViewHolder extends RecyclerView.ViewHolder {
+ TextView title, description, dateLocation;
+
+ public EventViewHolder(@NonNull View itemView) {
+ super(itemView);
+ title = itemView.findViewById(R.id.event_title);
+ description = itemView.findViewById(R.id.event_description);
+ dateLocation = itemView.findViewById(R.id.event_date_location);
+ }
+ }
+}
```

viewModel.getErrorMessage().observe(getViewLifecycleOwner(), errorMsg -> {\n if (errorMsg != null && !errorMsg.isEmpty()) {\n showError(errorMsg);\n }\n });\n }\n \n private void showLoading() {\n ```
@@ -1,1 +1,110 @@
+package com.northcoders.jvevents.fragment;
 
+import android.os.Bundle;
+import android.util.Log;
+import android.view.LayoutInflater;
+import android.view.View;
+import android.view.ViewGroup;
+import android.widget.ProgressBar;
+import android.widget.TextView;
+import android.widget.Toast;
+
+import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
+import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
+import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment;
+import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider;
+import androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView;
+
+import com.northcoders.jvevents.R;
+import com.northcoders.jvevents.adapter.EventsAdapter;
+import com.northcoders.jvevents.model.EventDTO;
+import com.northcoders.jvevents.viewmodel.MainViewModel;
+
+public class EventsFragment extends Fragment implements EventsAdapter.OnEventClickListener {
+ private static final String TAG = "EventsFragment";
+
+ private MainViewModel viewModel;
+ private RecyclerView recyclerView;
+ private EventsAdapter adapter;
+ private ProgressBar progressBar;
+ private TextView errorText;
+
+ @Nullable
+ @Override
+ public View onCreateView(@NonNull LayoutInflater inflater, @Nullable ViewGroup container, @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
+ return inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_events, container, false);
+ }
+
+ @Override
+ public void onViewCreated(@NonNull View view, @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
+ super.onViewCreated(view, savedInstanceState);
+
+ // Initialize views
+ recyclerView = view.findViewById(R.id.events_recycler_view);
+ progressBar = view.findViewById(R.id.progress_bar);
+ errorText = view.findViewById(R.id.error_text);
+
+ // Setup ViewModel
+ viewModel = new ViewModelProvider(requireActivity()).get(MainViewModel.class);
+
+ // Setup RecyclerView
+ adapter = new EventsAdapter(this);
+ recyclerView.setAdapter(adapter);
+
+ // Observe data
+ setupObservers();
+
+ // Load events
+ viewModel.loadEvents();
+ }
+
+ private void setupObservers() {
+ viewModel.getEvents().observe(getViewLifecycleOwner(), events -> {
+ if (events != null && !events.isEmpty()) {
+ adapter.setEvents(events);
+ showContent();
+ } else {
+ showError("No events found");
+ }
+ });
+
+ viewModel.isLoading().observe(getViewLifecycleOwner(), isLoading -> {
+ if (Boolean.TRUE.equals(isLoading)) {
+ showLoading();
+ }
+ });
+
+ viewModel.getErrorMessage().observe(getViewLifecycleOwner(), errorMsg -> {
+ if (errorMsg != null && !errorMsg.isEmpty()) {
+ showError(errorMsg);
+ }
+ });
+ }
+
+ private void showLoading() {
+ progressBar.setVisibility(View.VISIBLE);
+ recyclerView.setVisibility(View.GONE);
+ errorText.setVisibility(View.GONE);
+ }
+
+ private void showContent() {
+ progressBar.setVisibility(View.GONE);
+ recyclerView.setVisibility(View.VISIBLE);
+ errorText.setVisibility(View.GONE);
+ }
+
+ private void showError(String message) {
+ progressBar.setVisibility(View.GONE);
+ recyclerView.setVisibility(View.GONE);
+ errorText.setVisibility(View.VISIBLE);
+ errorText.setText(message);
+ }
+
+ @Override
+ public void onEventClick(EventDTO event) {
+ Toast.makeText(requireContext(),
+ "Selected event: " + event.getTitle(),
+ Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
+ Log.d(TAG, "Clicked on event: " + event.getTitle());
+ }
+}
```

The edit was successful with no linter errors."},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

Great! Now the app is ready to run. Here's a summary of what we've created:

1. **Models**:
 - `EventDTO.java` - Data model matching your backend
 - `AppUserDTO.java` - User model for event attendees

2. **API and Network**:
 - `ApiService.java` - API interface for your endpoints
 - `RetrofitInstance.java` - Retrofit setup for network calls

3. **Repository**:
 - `EventRepository.java` - For API communication

4. **ViewModel**:
 - `MainViewModel.java` - ViewModel for the UI

5. **UI Components**:
 - `MainActivity.java` - Main activity
 - `EventsFragment.java` - Fragment for displaying events
 - `EventsAdapter.java` - Adapter for the RecyclerView

6. **Layouts**:
 - `activity_main.xml`
 - `fragment_events.xml`
 - `item_event.xml`

To test this app:
1. Make sure your backend API is running
2. Update the `BASE_URL` in `RetrofitInstance.java` to point to your actual backend URL. If you're running locally on an emulator, use `http://10.0.2.2:8080/` 
3. Run the app

The app should connect to your backend, fetch all events, and display them in a list. Clicking on an event will show a toast message with the event title. This is a simple but functional start that you can build on further."}]},{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"<user_query>

To fix this, you have two options:

1. **Recommended**: Use HTTPS for your backend API

2. **For development only**: Allow cleartext traffic to your local server by adding a network security configuration. Here's how:

First, create a new file `network_security_config.xml`:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<network-security-config>
 <debug-overrides>
 <trust-anchors>
 <certificates src="system" />
 <certificates src="user" />
 </trust-anchors>
 </debug-overrides>
 <domain-config cleartextTrafficPermitted="true">
 <domain includeSubdomains="true">10.0.2.2</domain>
 </domain-config>
</network-security-config>
```

Then update your AndroidManifest.xml to use this configuration:

```xml
<application
 android:networkSecurityConfig="@xml/network_security_config"
 ... >
```

This will allow cleartext (HTTP) traffic to your local development server at 10.0.2.2. Remember this should only be used during development - in production, you should always use HTTPS.

@@ -1,1 +1,57 @@
+package com.northcoders.jvevents.ui.fragments;
 
+import android.os.Bundle;
+import android.util.Log;
+import android.view.LayoutInflater;
+import android.view.View;
+import android.view.ViewGroup;
+import android.widget.Toast;
+
+import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
+import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
+import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment;
+import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider;
+import androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView;
+
+import com.northcoders.jvevents.R;
+import com.northcoders.jvevents.adapter.EventsAdapter;
+import com.northcoders.jvevents.model.EventDTO;
+import com.northcoders.jvevents.viewmodel.MainViewModel;
+
+public class EventsFragment extends Fragment {
+ private static final String TAG = "EventsFragment";
+ private MainViewModel viewModel;
+ private RecyclerView recyclerView;
+ private EventsAdapter adapter;
+
+ @Override
+ public View onCreateView(LayoutInflater inflater, ViewGroup container, Bundle savedInstanceState) {
+ return inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_events, container, false);
+ }
+
+ @Override
+ public void onViewCreated(@NonNull View view, @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
+ super.onViewCreated(view, savedInstanceState);
+
+ // Setup RecyclerView
+ recyclerView = view.findViewById(R.id.events_recycler_view);
+ adapter = new EventsAdapter(event -> {
+ // Handle event click
+ Toast.makeText(requireContext(),
+ "Clicked: " + event.getTitle(),
+ Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
+ });
+ recyclerView.setAdapter(adapter);
+
+ // Setup ViewModel
+ viewModel = new ViewModelProvider(this).get(MainViewModel.class);
+ viewModel.getEvents().observe(getViewLifecycleOwner(), events -> {
+ if (events != null) {
+ adapter.setEvents(events);
+ }
+ });
+
+ // Load events
+ viewModel.loadEvents();
+ }
+}
